result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Daryl R. Smith was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 174 days presentence credit should supervision be revoked
shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim;   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
AMENDED 3/30/15 - SHALL PAY $16,747.00 TO VICTIM THROUGH THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE DURING THE PERIOD OF SUPERVISION.  DEFENDANT SHALL CONTACT THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE TO SET UP A PAYMENT SCHEDULE.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

superMiscConds.notes: Shall pay balance of restitution previously ordered;  The DOC shall deduct restitution and other court ordered financial obligations from the Defendant's prison income at a rate of 25% of the Defendant's income.

Defense Brief
Briefing order

Defendant Daryl R. Smith in court, in custody with attorney Michael J. Herbert.  ADAs Gib Thompson and James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion regarding inffective assistance of counsel heard. Atty Herbert heard. ADA Sempf heard. Atty Gergen s/t. Court takes recess to alow Atty Herbert to speak w/Def.
Back on record. Appearances same. Def waives atty/client privilege regarding relationship w/Atty Gergen. Atty Gergen s/t. Exhibit List prepared. Exhibits received. Atty Gergen released from subpoena. Court takes break.
Back on record. Appearances same. Daryl Smith s/t. Atty Herbert rests. ADA Thompson s/t. State rests. No rebuttal. Atty Herbert heard. ADA Sempf heard. Court heard and finds burden not met regarding ineffective counsel and denies motion regarding ineffective counsel. Discussion held regarding motion on restitution. Atty Herbert heard. ADA Sempf heard. Court will take agruments under advisement and issue written decision regarding restitution.  Question from the Court regarding Victim Compliance.  DA's office will inquire as to that compliance re: a motion hearing and upcoming motions. Concern by Defense of Court of Appeals deadlines. ADA and Defense to provide written brief on the restitution issue by 8-25-2017.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daryl R. Smith in court, in custody with attorney William Henry Gergen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard, will hear from Atty Rasmussen regarding a personal injury matter first. Scott Rasmussen S/T.  Casey Blanchette S/T. State does not take position as to what restituion should be. Atty Gergen heard, atty fees not recoverable, victim pd already, no evidence to support any further restitution. Court heard, victim has not been made hole, orders restitution in the amount of $16,747 to be paid during the period of probation to be pd to CoC. Judgment be amended accordingly.
Hearing on April 27, 2015 at 12:30 pm.

Defendant Daryl R. Smith in court, in custody.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard regarding two issues set for today - restitution and request to reinstate huber. Court heard, Atty Gergen is not representing Def. regarding reinstatment of huber. Court questions Def. Atty Thompson heard, does not believe Def. should get huber reinstated. Atty Bolles heard, does not represent Def. in this matter, but does in another pending matter, states alleged victim in pending matter does not wish to have no contact provision in place. Atty Thompson heard. Atty Bolles heard. Court heard, will not grant or deny request at this time, will put off this matter until end of April, after 21st.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 12:30 pm.
